subs.text: Writers often use commonplace books to record quotations that they may want to come back to someday and build on. For writers who don't have much of an audience on Twitter, Twitter itself acts like an easy-to-write-in but not-easy-to-read-later commonplace book. So, not so good.

subs.text: Odd @NPR lingo thing these days: using present tense verbs to describe past events. Here, the reporter asks questions about past actions using present tense verbs even when the interviewee speaks of her past life with past tense verbs. Weird tic, @NPR. [link]

subs.text: If you rent enough rooms, a venue puts your name up in lights. In Orlando, we all walked into a wide dining room. One long wall was a kelpy aquarium where Disney scuba divers held ‚ÄúWelcome AGLSP‚Äù signs, finny beings swam by on all levels, and bubbles wobbled up and out of sight.

subs.text: Since mass shooters often leave torturous manifestos or computers filled with wretched political content related to the shooting, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the shooting. It is already political.
subs.rawText: Since mass shooters often leave torturous manifestos or computers filled with wretched political content related to the shooting, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the shooting. It is already political.

subs.text: Since the access to weapons is shaped by public policy and political action over many years, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the mass shooting. It is already political.
subs.rawText: Since the access to weapons is shaped by public policy and political action over many years, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the mass shooting. It is already political.

subs.text: Since victims of a mass shooting were entitled to their lives and liberty, which are rights won through political struggle, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the mass shooting. It is already political.
subs.rawText: Since victims of a mass shooting were entitled to their lives and liberty, which are rights won through political struggle, it is not the politician speaking later that politicizes the mass shooting. It is already political.

subs.text:
Will a Republican respond to pressure and change? Not readily.

But people ridiculed their empty ‚Äúthoughts and prayers‚Äù tweets so hard that those are rare now. In recent tweets, new phrases serve a similar function.

So it is possible to get a Republican to use different words.
